intro: Sericocoma namaensis, commonly known as the Namibian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Namibia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in a compact inflorescence. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand the harsh, dry conditions of its natural habitat. Sericocoma namaensis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest to botanists studying desert flora.
